Utterance: Hi there! Welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay. I did some research on local organizations, and I found a couple I’m interested in!
That’s fantastic! Which organizations did you find?
There’s one that focuses on marine conservation and another that works with local aquariums for educational programs.
Great choices! Have you reached out to them yet?
Not yet. I’m a bit nervous about contacting them.
That’s completely normal. Would it help to role-play how you might approach them?
Yeah, that could help.
Let’s imagine you’re sending an email to the conservation organization. What would you say?
Um, I’d probably start with introducing myself and expressing my interest in their work. Then I’d ask if they have any volunteer opportunities.
That sounds good! You could also mention your background in marine biology and your passion for conservation.
Right, that would make it more personal.
Exactly! How about we draft a quick email together?
Sure, that sounds helpful.
Let’s start with your introduction. “Hello, my name is [Your Name], and I recently graduated with a degree in marine biology…”
“I’m passionate about marine conservation and am eager to gain hands-on experience…”
Perfect! Now, how would you ask about volunteer opportunities?
“I was wondering if you have any current or upcoming volunteer positions available?”
Great! How do you feel about that?
I feel a bit more confident.
Awesome! Would you like to set a goal to send that email by the end of the week?
Yes, I can do that!
Wonderful! Now, let’s talk about your sleep. How have things been since we last spoke?
I’ve been trying to stick to my bedtime routine, and I think it’s helping a little.
That’s great to hear! Have you noticed any changes in how you feel during the day?
I think I’m a bit less anxious during the day, which is nice.
That’s a positive sign! How about your mood overall?
I still have some ups and downs, but I feel like I’m managing it better.
That’s progress! Remember, it’s okay to have fluctuations. It’s part of the human experience.
Yeah, I’m trying to remind myself of that.
Good. If you ever feel overwhelmed, you can always return to your breathing exercises or your hiking routine to help ground yourself.
I’ll keep that in mind.
Is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to talk about?
I’ve been thinking about my relationship with my boyfriend. Sometimes I feel like I’m leaning on him too much for support.
It’s healthy to reflect on relationships. Can you tell me more about that?
I just worry that I’m relying on him to help me feel better, and I don’t want to burden him.
It’s important to have support, but it’s also essential to find balance. How can you ensure you’re both supporting each other?
I guess I could try to be more open with him about how I’m feeling instead of just venting all the time.
That’s a great idea. Communication is key in any relationship. Perhaps you could set aside time to check in with each other about how you’re both feeling?
Yeah, I think that would help.
Excellent! Let’s set that as a goal for you to discuss with him.
Okay, I’ll bring it up.
You’re doing really well. Remember, it’s all about taking small steps.
Thanks, Ellie. I feel like I’m making progress.
You absolutely are! I’m proud of you for facing these challenges. Let’s touch base again soon and see how everything is going.
Sounds good! Bye for now!
Goodbye!
